TopicTitle: TOOB Parts: Gaps Created Between TOOB Base End and Fairing Through Duplication

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.1.3 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Linux Ubuntu 20.04.6 | CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 3400G | GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080 Ti | RAM: 16GB

Severity: Med (Causes craft to look wrong and ugly.)

Frequency: High (Always occurs)

Description: 

When TOOB parts are duplicated the variable length fairing section becomes offset from the base ring section.  This gap increases with each duplication.  There should never be a gap between the base and the fairing of the TOOB.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Start a new vehicle in the VAB.
  2. Select any TOOB part from the structural section of the parts manager.
  3. Duplicate the TOOB: With the selection tool hold the Alt key and click on the first TOOB.
  4. Attach it to the fairing end of the TOOB.
  5. Duplicate again starting with the original TOOB.
  6. Attach to the fairing end again.
  7. Observer that there is a gap between the faring and base of the 3rd TOOB.
  8. Continue duplicating the entire assembly and attaching the duplicate to the top fairing end.
  9. Observer more gaps and also observe that the gaps get wider with each duplication.
